alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Campbell; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued November 18 at 9:05AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... The Virginia Department of Environmental Quality has issued a health alert through this afternoon due to unhealthy particle concentrations due to the smoke from the Matt Creek wildfire in Bedford County. The counties affected are: Bedford, Pittsylvania, and Campbell until such time as smoke clears. Air quality measurements from US Forest Service air monitor in Bedford has been indicating unhealthy air this morning. Active children and adults should limit or reschedule strenuous outdoor activities until conditions improve. People unusually sensitive to air pollution, especially those with heart or lung disease (including asthma), should avoid strenuous outdoor activities until conditions improve. Take more breaks, do less intense activities. People with asthma should follow their asthma action plans and keep quick-relief medicine handy. If you can see/smell smoke near the ground, consider Code Orange or worse conditions and take the necessary precautions, especially if you have existing heart or lung ailments including asthma. For additional information, please visit the Virginia Department of Environmental Quality`s air quality website at: www.deq.virginia.gov/air/monitoring-assessments/air-quality- forecast.
